actions.text: By unanimous consent, the Velazquez amendment was withdrawn.
Amendment (A009) offered by Ms. Velazquez to the Frelinghuysen amendment (A003).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A009) offered by Ms. Velazquez to the Frelinghuysen amendment (A003).

amends_amendment.description: An amendment numbered 1 printed in Part C of House Report 113-1 to provide an additional $33.677 billion in total spending to cover current and anticipated needs in the wake of the devastating Hurricane Sandy. This funding is in addition to the amendment submitted by Chairman Rogers.
amends_amendment.purpose: Amendment provides an additional $33.677 billion in total spending to cover current and anticipated needs in the wake of Hurricane Sandy. As amended, see item 40 (Fleming amendment) and item 42 (Bishop (UT) amendment).

description: An amendment numbered 7 printed in Part C of House Report 113-1 to increase the Community Development Fund appropriation amount by $25 million offset by reductions elsewhere in the bill.
purpose: An amendment numbered 7 printed in Part C of House Report 113-1 to increase the Community Development Fund appropriation amount by $25 million offset by reductions elsewhere in the bill.
